perturbation.original_text: (b) Each Seller agrees that for a period commencing on the Effective Date and ending two years after the Closing Date (the "Non- Compete Period"), it shall not, other than solely through its direct or indirect ownership of Buyer's capital stock or any other interests in Buyer, directly, or indirectly, including through or on behalf of a subsidiary, anywhere in the world, excluding India: (i) own, manage, operate or control any business which competes with any Combined Business or (ii) be or become a shareholder, partner, member or owner of any Person who is engaged in any Combined Business; provided, however that nothing in this Agreement shall: (i) prohibit or restrict any Seller, directly or indirectly, from owning, as a passive investor, not more than five (5%) percent collectively and in the aggregate of any class of outstanding publicly traded securities of any Person so engaged; (ii) prohibit or restrict any Seller, directly or indirectly, from engaging in such Seller's business as conducted on the Effective Date and reasonable extensions thereof, which may include routine, day-to-day transactions with any entity, and (iii) apply to or restrict any business of which a Seller acquires control after the Effective Date provided that the acquired business did not receive more than $25,000,000 of its aggregate net sales (as measured during the 12 full calendar months prior to such acquisition) from product lines included within the definition of Company Business. Each Seller agrees that this covenant is reasonable with respect to its duration, geographical area and scope. For purposes of this Agreement, the term "control" (including the terms "controlled by" and "under common control with") means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management and policies of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Each Seller acknowledges that for a period commencing on the Effective Date and ending two years after the Closing Date (the "Non- Compete Period"), it may choose not to, other than solely through its direct or indirect ownership of Buyer's capital stock or any other interests in Buyer, directly, or indirectly, including through or on behalf of a subsidiary, anywhere in the world, excluding India: (i) own, manage, operate or supervise any venture that vies with any Combined Business or (ii) be or become a shareholder, partner, member or possessor of any Entity who is involved in any Combined Business; provided, however that nothing in this Agreement shall: (i) prohibit or restrict any Seller, directly or indirectly, from owning, as a passive investor, not more than five (5%) percent collectively and in the aggregate of any class of outstanding publicly traded securities of any Person so engaged; (ii) prohibit or restrict any Seller, directly or indirectly, from participating in such Seller's business as conducted on the Effective Date and reasonable extensions thereof, which may include routine, day-to-day transactions with any entity, and (iii) apply to or restrict any business of which a Seller gains influence over after the Effective Date provided that the acquired business did not receive more than $25,000,000 of its aggregate net sales (as measured during the 12 full calendar months prior to such acquisition) from product lines included within the definition of Company Business. Each Seller acknowledges that this understanding is suggestive with respect to its duration, geographical area and scope. For purposes of this Agreement, the term "control" (including the terms "controlled by" and "under common control with") signifies the potential, directly or indirectly, to guide or influence the direction of the management and guidelines of a Person, whether through the ownership of voting securities, by contract or otherwise.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'agrees' is replaced with 'acknowledges' turning the binding contract into a mere acknowledgement, where the language 'shall not' becomes 'may choose not to' introducing ambiguity as to whether the seller is actually prohibited from competing. Also replaced synonymous terms such as 'business' to 'venture' 'competes' to 'vies' 'owner' to 'possessor' 'person' to 'entity' to create ambiguity on the scope. Similarly, 'covenant' becomes 'understanding' and 'reasonable' becomes 'suggestive' weakening the clause.

perturbation.original_text: 5. Injunctive Relief; Attorneys Fees. Each Seller agrees that in the event of a breach of this Agreement, the damage to Buyer will be inestimable and that therefore any remedy at Law or in monetary damages shall be inadequate. Accordingly, the parties agree that Buyer shall, in addition to monetary damages incurred by reason of any such breach or potential breach, without the necessity of posting any bond or similar instrument (and Sellers hereby irrevocably waive any right it may have to require the obtaining, furnishing or posting of any such bond or similar instrument) be entitled to seek injunctive relief (including specific performance) against the Sellers for breach of this Agreement. If any action or proceeding shall be commenced to enforce this Agreement or any right arising in connection with this Agreement, the prevailing party in such action or proceeding shall be entitled to recover from the other party the reasonable attorneys' fees, costs and expenses incurred by such prevailing party in connection with such action or proceeding.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. Equitable Measures; Legal Costs. Each Seller suggests that in the event of a violation of this Understanding, the harm to Buyer might be immeasurable and that consequently any recourse at Law or in financial compensations might be insufficient. Accordingly, the parties imply that Buyer may, in addition to financial compensations sustained by reason of any such infraction or prospective infraction, without the necessity of filing any security or similar device (and Sellers hereby tentatively set aside any entitlement they might possess to demand the securing, providing or filing of any such security or similar device) be permitted to pursue equitable measures (including explicit fulfillment) against the Sellers for violation of this Understanding. If any action or process shall be started to apply this Understanding or any entitlement arising in connection with this Understanding, the successful participant in such action or process may reclaim from the other participant the fitting legal costs, expenditures and charges sustained by such successful participant in connection with such action or process.
perturbation.explanation: Replaced synonymous terms such as 'Injunctive Relief' to 'Equitable Measures' 'Attorneys Fees' to 'Legal Costs' 'breach' to 'violation/infraction' 'Agreement' to 'Understanding' 'damage' to 'harm' 'remedy' to 'recourse' 'monetary damages' to 'financial compensations' to create ambiguity on the scope. Also replaced 'agrees' with 'suggests/implies' and 'waive' with 'tentatively set aside' to weaken the clause. Changed 'specific performance' to 'explicit fulfillment', 'action or proceeding' to 'action or process', and 'prevailing party' to 'successful participant'. These changes undermine the clarity and enforceability of the clause, making it difficult to determine the exact remedies and cost recovery available to the buyer.
